alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 11 at 6:55PM CDT until April 11 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Atoka County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 654 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 5 miles east of Stringtown, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Stringtown, Daisy, northern McGee Creek Lake, Redden and northeastern Atoka Reservoir. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
